data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The first instruction tells you to always face forward. The second instruction tells you to always face left. The third instruction tells you to always face right. Therefore, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 4 steps. Turn around and turn around. Turn around and turn right. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take one more step than you traveled to the starting point.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn your back to where you started. To turn left, use a left to turn left. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Taking 10 steps can take you anywhere you want it to be. Taking 9 steps can take you anywhere you want it to be. Taking 3 steps to turn around also can take you anywhere you want it to be. So, the answer is Yes.

If you turn around right, you turn left again. This way, you’ll go back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

To get from one end of a path to the other, one takes the same amount of forward and lateral steps as the direction being traveled. If you take the same amount of steps twice on different steps, every step has to be repeated on the same path you are traveling on. So, the answer is yes.

Take 2 steps to return to the starting point. Turn around your body ten times and take another 6 steps back to start. So, the answer is no.

Take 1 step right. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. So, the answer is No.

Doing the same thing backwards takes you to backwards. Walking in one direction takes you back to the same place, and being in the opposite direction takes you back to forward. So, the answer is Yes.

You always face forward. In the first 5 steps, you take 1 step forward, then take 5 steps right. In the first 8 steps, you take 8 steps left, then take 5 steps left, then take 6 steps backward. You always take 1 step forward and take 3 steps right. So, the answer is Yes.

You need to use the left lateral axis if you are facing to the right. This axis works the same way as the right lateral axis but there is an added component.
